EmailTemplate.subject: Your 2021 Technology Refresh Order
EmailTemplate.textOnly: It’s time to review your 2021 Technology Refresh Order As the preferred in-restaurant provider for McDonald’s US restaurants, NCR is pleased to support the 2021 Technology Refresh initiative to further support the digital capabilities for McDonald’s restaurants. We are reaching out today to inform you about hardware in scope and what to expect from NCR during this initiative. Information about your Technology Refresh Order NCR has uploaded hardware replacement orders to MyNCR.com for restaurants that have end-of-life equipment in scope for the 2021 Technology Refresh initiative. The below list contains end-of-life hardware in scope and the steps to take to place an order. End-of-life hardware in scope for the 2021 Technology Refresh Type of Hardware Hardware Model Replacement Hardware Register JS960 Par 7700 NCR CX7 KVS, ORB and EPROD Controller Dell Wyse Z Class Lenovo M625q eSmart Clock JS960 eSmart Clock Par 7700 eSmart Clock Dell Wyse eSmart Clock with a Z90 Zclass Controller CX7 eSmart Clock Kiosk Controllers Lenovo M93P Lenovo M400 To be determined by McDonald’s at a later date No more excel quotes for Technology Refresh Programs  Operators will receive an email notification from MyNCR once their 2021 Technology Hardware order is uploaded. Operators who have not previously activated their MyNCR account can do so by going to the MyNCR <[[http://myncr.ncr.com/]]> home page and selecting the forgot password link and input their partners.mcd.com email address to go through the process to set up their account credentials. Once operator receive their “Pending Order” notification and have active credentials, they should click on the link to log in to MyNCR to review and accept their order. If the order requires changes, operators can decline the order with a comment for NCR to take action. For information about the order process, click here <[[https://go.ncr.com/rs/605-BQY-740/images/2021 McD Tech Refresh - MyNCR Order Guide.pdf]]> to view the 2021 Technology Refresh Order Guide. Please Note: All self-install orders have a $95 dollar Installation Support line item that cannot be removed from the order. This covers installation support issues that your OTP may encounter. Extend end-of-life hardware lifecycle  In an effort to provide technology that better serves you and your restaurants, the Windows 10 operating system upgrade is now available for select restaurant devices. Completing this upgrade provides ongoing security protection of the McDonald’s brand. Hardware that can be reimaged with Win 10 images are: Type of Hardware Model Registers XR7, JS970 (JS970WSUM75), ES8315 KVS, ORB and EPROD Controllers KC4, HP T630 eSmart Clock P1235, es550 Kiosk Controllers Diebold K1.0, Diebold K2.0, Dell Wyse 7040 Hardware that will need a Win 10 Operating System License purchased prior to Win 10 image upgrade (this Win 10 Operating System License can be purchased through Insight): Type of Hardware Model Registers JS970 - (JS970WP01B8, JS970WSUM71, JS970WPUM71, JS970XSUM71) KVS, ORB and EPROD Controllers Dell Wyse 93L, Dell Wyse 98L eSmart Clock JS970 lite Smart Clock (ESC-JS970WP01B8-M) Restaurants with an OTP 1 or OTP 2 must engage a professional install technician to reimage hardware at the site. Sites utilizing a professional install technician are required to show proof of purchase of the Windows 10 Operating System license to the technician if required. Prior to the installation visit, NCR will also validate that the licenses were purchased for the devices. Pricing for this service can be obtained by calling the Customer Care Center via email at mcdonalds.orders@ncr.com <[[mailto:mcdonalds.orders@ncr.com]]> or by phone at 800.421.8230 on Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. ET to 8:00 p.m. ET. The time frame that a technician is required to be on-site to reimage hardware will vary according to the number of devices at the restaurant. - 1-6 devices: The installation can be completed during the day while avoiding rush hour time frames - 7-14 devices: Installation will require the restaurant to close at 9 p.m. and the site will be returned to on-site crew members by 4 a.m. - 15+devices: Installation will require the restaurant to close at 9PM and the site will be returned to on-site crew members by 4 a.m. for two consecutive days Once NCR has completed your Win 10 upgrade activity, your break fix contracts will be updated to the Win 10 version of the hardware. If a restaurant has an OTP 3 that will reimage the hardware themselves, the OTP 3 should call the Customer Care Center to update their break fix contracts. Failure to notify NCR will cause issues with Break-Fix swap returns if NCR’s records do not reflect Windows 10 image update on hardware. Break-Fix Implications to consider End-of-life hardware in scope for the 2021 Technology Refresh that you wish to continue to use after October 1, 2021 will need to have an extended security license purchased for those units. Details on these licenses are forthcoming. These units will be considered replace upon failure as of October 1, 2021. For questions or concerns about your 2021 Technology Refresh order, please contact the Account Executive for your field office or the NCR Customer Care team via email at Mcdonalds.Orders@ncr.com <[[mailto:Mcdonalds.Orders@ncr.com]]> or by phone at 800.421.8230 on Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m ET to 8:00 p.m. ET.
